projects.title: Graduation Project - Photographer & Customer Matching Platform
projects.description:
**Team Project | Frontend (React Native)**

A mobile-based matching service connecting photographers and customers. Developed as a production-level MVP including photography style filters, reservation systems, and review/community features.

### What I built
- Implemented overall mobile UI using React Native
- Developed photographer search, portfolio, reservation, and community screens
- Managed front-end state considering JWT-based authentication flows

### Key features
- Category-based photographer search and detailed portfolio viewing
- Reservation request flow (Customer ‚Üí Photographer) and acceptance/rejection flow (Photographer ‚Üí Customer)
- Community board supporting reviews and comments

### Troubleshooting: Performance Optimization for Large Image Lists
- **Issue**: Memory usage spiked during scrolling of photographer lists containing high-resolution portfolio images, leading to app crashes.
- **Solution**: Optimized FlatList by adjusting `windowSize` and `initialNumToRender` to release off-screen resources and introduced image resizing caching strategies.
- **Result**: Reduced memory usage by **60%** (450MB ‚Üí 180MB) and maintained a stable **60FPS** scroll frame rate.

### Technical focus
- Handled loading/error UX considering mobile API latency
- Applied FlatList lazy rendering + server-side pagination
- Collaboration based on Git Flow (Experience with PRs and Code Reviews)

### Takeaway
- Realized that UX and performance are directly linked in a mobile environment
- Developed a habit of designing user flows before implementing features

projects.title: Nobel Prize Archive: Exploring Human Intellect (TS Refactoring & AI Translation)
projects.description:
**Personal Project | Frontend (React ¬∑ TypeScript ¬∑ Vite)**

A service for exploring Nobel Prize data from 1901 to the present using the official Nobel Prize API. Beyond just listing data, I maximized user experience through **AI real-time translation** and **data refining logic**.

### What I built
- **Legacy Refactoring**: Converted a CRA + JS environment 100% to Vite + TypeScript, reducing build time by 95% and ensuring type stability.
- **AI-based Multilingual Support**: Integrated **Google Translate API** to provide real-time Korean translation for English achievement data.

### Troubleshooting: Solving Slow Build Speeds and Runtime Type Errors
- **Issue**: HMR speed exceeded 10 seconds as features were added, decreasing productivity. Frequent runtime data inconsistency errors due to JS-based project characteristics.
- **Solution**: Replaced Webpack-based CRA with esbuild-based **Vite**. Stabilized API response data processing logic by introducing a Strict Type System.
- **Result**: Reduced local server startup time by **90%** (15s ‚Üí 1.5s), build speed by **95%**, and achieved **0 runtime errors** after implementation.

### Technical Focus
- **Strict Type System**: Designed precise interfaces excluding the `any` type
- **Technical SEO**: Completed Sitemap.xml generation and Google Search Console indexing

projects.title: Data Analysis - YouTube Channel Revenue Optimization
projects.description:
**Role: Data Collection ¬∑ Analysis ¬∑ Visualization**

A project that collected YouTube API data to analyze metrics such as views, subscriber growth, and upload patterns to derive insights for content strategy. Focused on "how to actually change strategy" rather than just presenting statistics.

### What I did
- Collected large-scale data via YouTube API and loaded it into a MySQL DB
- Performed Python-based data cleaning and Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA)
- Designed Tableau dashboards and visualized core KPIs

### Key Insights
- Derived meaningful patterns between upload days and view counts
- Analyzed the impact of video length on watch time and revenue
- Confirmed that the relationship between views and revenue isn't always proportional ‚Üí provided hints for ad revenue optimization

### Technical Focus
- Designed a batch request + MySQL storage structure to solve API rate-limiting issues
- Redesigned the dashboard UI to be decision-friendly by focusing on KPIs
- Handled data cleaning and outlier processing to ensure data reliability

### Takeaway
- Experienced the end-to-end data pipeline: collection ‚Üí storage ‚Üí analysis ‚Üí visualization
- Realized what constitutes an analysis that helps meaningful decision-making
- Expanded business interpretation skills beyond technical stacks

projects.title: Spring Boot-based Board Web Application
projects.description:

projects.title: Real-time Multilingual Translation Chat Web
projects.description:
**Role: Full-stack Development**

A real-time translation chat platform using WebSockets and Google Translation API. Focused on designing a full-stack architecture that efficiently integrates external APIs while ensuring real-time performance.

### What I Did
- Designed and implemented Socket.IO-based real-time bidirectional communication
- Implemented Google Translation API integration and automatic language detection
- Ensured data persistence and chat log storage using MongoDB
- Built a user-centric real-time chat UI/UX and responsive web design

### Troubleshooting: Optimizing External API Latency and Cost
- **Issue**: Latency of over 2.5s due to translation API calls for every message sent, along with wasted costs for redundant sentences.
- **Solution**: Implemented a translation result caching layer using MongoDB and applied **Optimistic UI** to reduce perceived wait time.
- **Result**: Improved response latency by **68%** (2.5s ‚Üí 0.8s) and reduced redundant costs by approximately **40%**.

### Takeaway
- Deeply understood and implemented real-time data processing mechanisms through WebSockets
- Acquired practical skills in integrating external cloud services (GCP) into production
- Strengthened service design and troubleshooting capabilities from a full-stack perspective
